planSelectionPO.hintText:
Max. 20 characters
A social insurance number (SIN) is a 9-digit number.>

beneficiariesDescription.item: You can decide what will happen to your savings after you die by designating one or more beneficiaries. If you don't designate a beneficiary or none of them survive you, the money will automatically go to your estate, unless the law requires otherwise.
Generally, you can change your beneficiaries at any time using your online account.

beneficiarySuccessorPO.beneficiariesSuccessorSubHeader: Appoint a spouse or common-law partner who would become the owner of your TFSA when you die.
beneficiarySuccessorPO.primarySuccessorDeleteQuestion: Are you sure you want to delete TestSuccessor Testsample0329?
beneficiarySuccessorPO.beneficiariesPrimarySubHeader: Choose who you want to receive your savings when you die. Then specify the percentage of savings they should receive. Make sure the total adds up to 100% for each plan.
beneficiarySuccessorPO.addSuccessorBeneficiaryHintLabel: All fields are required unless labelled as optional.

primarySuccessorInvalidFirstName.initial: Enter a valid first name that contains only letters, hyphens, spaces, apostrophes, brackets and periods.

beneficiarySuccessorPO.primarySuccessorFirstNameError: Enter your successor holder's first name.

primarySuccessorInvalidLastName.initial: Enter a valid last name that contains only letters, hyphens, spaces, apostrophes, brackets and periods.

beneficiarySuccessorPO.primarySuccessorLastNameError: Enter your successor holder's last name.

primarySuccessorInvalidSIN.initial: Enter a valid 9-digit social insurance number.

beneficiarySuccessorPO.primarySuccessorSINError: Enter a valid 9-digit social insurance number.
beneficiarySuccessorPO.primarySuccessorDateOfBirthHint: Your successor holder must be at least 18 years old.

primarySuccessorDateOfBirthError.expected: Enter a valid date of birth.

beneficiarySuccessorPO.primarySuccessorDateOfBirthError: Enter your successor holder's full date of birth.
